msgSnippet: jeffwaltzer Mon, 13 Dec 2004 23:06:19 -0000 ... Would having the JDT/PDE JUnit support _not_ grab focus on test failure solve your problem? (Getting focus
messageBody:
jeffwaltzer Mon, 13 Dec 2004 23:06:19 -0000
> Not happy with Abbot for SWT as it injects events at the operating
> system level,

... which is what makes it an actual test :-)

> forcing the SWT being tested to have focus at the operating level
> (painful when Eclipse grabs focus back on test failure).

Would having the JDT/PDE JUnit support _not_ grab focus on test
failure solve your problem? (Getting focus initially is not a
problem.) If so, consider putting a bug or FR on it, or making a
request on the upcoming

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/~checkout~/hyades-home/docs/unapproveddrafts/project%20info/plans/3+/features/hf_74796.html


(Note that Hyades/TPTP is gonna be absorbing JUnit support sometime
next year.)

> Has anybody out there managed to create a mock Display or mock shell
> objects?

Try asking on the eclipse.platform.swt newsgroup, or

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/java-gui-testing/

> Is PDEUnit worth trying to use?

Not sure what you mean by "PDEUnit": if you mean the PDE JUnit UI
(e.g. "JUnit Plug-in Test", aka pde.junit), it behaves much like the
"straight" JUnit UI.

> I did not want to go and make plugins when all I want to do is to
> make sure a Composite is functioning properly.

Correct, esp if you're doing RCP.
